name: Healthier Soft Oatmeal Cookies
author: MakeItHealthy
summary: My family loves these oatmeal cookies, and with my made-over version, they are a great way to sneak extra fiber and grains into their diet! I reduce the sugar, add whole wheat, use rolled oats and add dates (for extra fiber!)
directions: Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar with an electric mixer in a large bowl until smooth
Add eggs, one at a time, allowing each egg to blend into the butter mixture before adding the next
Combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon in a separate bowl; stir into butter mixture
Cover and chill dough for at least one hour
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Roll dough into walnut-sized balls and place 2 inches apart onto baking sheets
Flatten each cookie with a large fork
Bake in preheated oven until cookies are golden brown, 8 to 10 minutes
Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely
